metadata.title: CVE-2022-4139 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An incorrect TLB flush issue was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s GPU i915kernel driver, potentially leading to random memory corruption or dataleaks. This flaw could allow a local user to crash the system or escalatetheir privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4139` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
